thread.title: Siena's Javion Ogunyemi still waiting for NCAA ruling
thread.title_full: Siena's Javion Ogunyemi still waiting for NCAA ruling - Times Union

author: Mark Singelais
title: Siena's Javion Ogunyemi still waiting for NCAA ruling
text:
Photo: Paul Buckowski Image 1 of / 5 5 Siena's Javion Ogunyemi, left, puts up a shot over Iona defenders during the Siena Iona men's basketball game on Sunday, Jan. 12, 2014 in Albany, NY. (Paul Buckowski / Times Union) Siena's Javion Ogunyemi, left, puts up a shot over Iona defenders during the Siena Iona men's basketball game on Sunday, Jan. 12, 2014 in Albany, NY. (Paul Buckowski / Times Union) Photo: Paul Buckowski Image 2 of 5 Buy photo Siena's Javion Ogunyemi, center, controls the rebound during their basketball game against UAlbany on Saturday Dec. 13, 2014, at Times Union Center in Albany, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union) Siena's Javion Ogunyemi, center, controls the rebound during their basketball game against UAlbany on Saturday Dec. 13, 2014, at Times Union Center in Albany, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union) Buy this photo Photo: Cindy Schultz Image 3 of 5 Buy photo Javion Ogunyemi of Siena goes to put up a shot during their game against Bucknell at the Times Union Center on Sunday, Dec. 28, 2014, in Albany, N.Y. (Paul Buckowski / Times Union) Javion Ogunyemi of Siena goes to put up a shot during their game against Bucknell at the Times Union Center on Sunday, Dec. 28, 2014, in Albany, N.Y. (Paul Buckowski / Times Union) Buy this photo Photo: Paul Buckowski Image 4 of 5 Buy photo Javion Ogunyemi of Siena puts up a shot during their game against Iona at the Times Union Center on Sunday, Jan. 4, 2014, in Albany, N.Y. (Paul Buckowski / Times Union) Javion Ogunyemi of Siena puts up a shot during their game against Iona at the Times Union Center on Sunday, Jan. 4, 2014, in Albany, N.Y. (Paul Buckowski / Times Union) Buy this photo Photo: Paul Buckowski Image 5 of 5 Buy photo Javion Ogunyemi of Siena grabs a rebound during their game against Iona at the Times Union Center on Sunday, Jan. 4, 2014, in Albany, N.Y. (Paul Buckowski / Times Union) Javion Ogunyemi of Siena grabs a rebound during their game against Iona at the Times Union Center on Sunday, Jan. 4, 2014, in Albany, N.Y. (Paul Buckowski / Times Union) Buy this photo Photo: Paul Buckowski Siena's Javion Ogunyemi still waiting for NCAA ruling 1 / 5 Back to Gallery Loudonville
With less than a month remaining until the opener, Siena junior forward Javion Ogunyemi of Troy still doesn't know whether he's going to play this season.
Ogunyemi said he has yet to hear from the NCAA on his appeal for a waiver that would give him immediate eligibility. As it stands now, Ogunyemi must sit out a season because he transferred to Boston University this summer before changing his mind and returning to Siena.
Ogunyemi, who is able to practice, took part in Siena's 40-minute intrasquad scrimmage Tuesday. He was playing with the green team (reserves) against the white team (starters).
"I'm still waiting just like everybody else," Ogunyemi said before practice. "I just want to know pretty much whether or not I'm going to be able to help this year. I mean, I plan on helping this year, anyway, in practice, but I just want to know whether I'll be able to play."
Siena compliance coordinator Melissa Peach sent Ogunyemi an email last week letting him know that once she hears from the NCAA, he'll be the first to know, Ogunyemi said.
Siena is appealing on Ogunyemi's behalf on the grounds that personal hardship led him to return to Loudonville. His cousin, Tyreek Prince , was fatally shot this past May 31 in Troy. That followed the death of Ogunyemi's mother, Thomasina Schultz , in August 2013.
Ogunyemi said Boston University coach Joe Jones sent a letter to the NCAA on his behalf.
"I appreciate it a lot," Ogunyemi said. " Coach Jones knew when I was out there, and the stuff I was going through with my family, I was struggling. He knew I wasn't just out there to spend a summer there. He just knew that I was going through a lot and the letter would help me, because he wants to see me do well."
Siena coach Jimmy Patsos said he's optimistic Ogunyemi will win his appeal, because the NCAA asked for more documentation recently.
"They came back and said, 'We need more things,'" Patsos said. "They didn't say, 'No.'"
Ogunyemi averaged 9.3 points and 4.8 rebounds last season. His return would boost the depth of a frontcourt that returns junior forward Brett Bisping and senior center Imoh Silas from injury; the Saints also add freshman center Evan Fisher . Silas sat out last week with a strained back but has returned to action.
"(Ogunyemi) is huge," Patsos added. "Big difference if we get him. We'll survive without him, but I'd much rather have him."
msingelais@timesunion.com • 518-454-5509 • @MarkSingelais
